_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Lima South Terminal complies with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA)#58(2001 Edition at the time of construction) for Liquified Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Shawnee Township Fire Department as well as the Allen County LEPC, as necessary.  Medical emergencies will require notification to the local Emergency Management Services and St. Rita's Hospital.



Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Lima South Terminal is a bulk gasoline (kerosene/deisel) storage facility with butane blending capabilities.  The Risk Management Program (RMP) covers the butane blending system including the storage vessels, pump, and associated piping and appurtenances.  Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Lima South Terminal complies with the U. S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) accident prevention rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119), and all applicable state and local laws and regulations. This butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer's instructions. The Butane Blending System is approved by the State Fire Marshall. 



To date, this facility has never had an accident involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.  In the event of an emergency involving the Buckeye Terminals, LLC - Lima South Terminal's butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Shawnee Township Fire Department and request their assistance.  Secondary response is provided by the City of Lima Fire Department and a variety of local volunteer departments (Perry Township Fire Department, etc.). The facility emergency response plans are coordi

nated with the fire department and the Allen County LEPC.  The Shawnee Township Fire Department has participated in RMP/PSM orientation/training session for this system (February 15, 2013) and is aware of the process. In addition, periodic coordination activities are performed with the local emergency responders.



Buckeye continually evaluates the process for opportunities to improve safety. Also, Buckeye makes every effort to coordinate annually at minimum with the local responders.
